description.description:
Description of pipeline.

This can be a brief explanation of what the pipeline does, this is useful for better understanding of what the pipeline is actually doing.
description.title: Description

enabled.description:
Set as 'false' to disable a Pipeline. Defaults to 'true'.

This field can be used to disable a pipeline to test some effect or in scenarios where the pipeline might need to be disabled.
enabled.title: Enable Pipeline

envs.description:
Useful to define custom environment variables which could be accessed by stages during pipeline execution.

[Read more about pipeline environments over here](/docs/pipelines/concepts/envs-for-stage)
envs.title: Pipeline Environments

global_envs.description: Global Envs will be saved to the cluster and can be used in the pipeline.

description.description: Description of the global variable to indicate what exactly this variable is for.
description.title: Description

id.description: Unique Identifier for the Global variable.
id.title: Variable ID

key.description: Key of the global variable. This key can be used to use this global variable in the pipeline.
key.title: Key

label.description: Name of the global variable for reference and to be shown in the UI.
label.title: Label

validate.description: To validate the entered value of the global variable. This field can be used to validate the value entered for the current variable by following the specified validators.

body.description:
At times, there might be the need to pass the body in a response in order to get the `expected_status`. This is also supported by passing the body in the `body` field.

The body should be passed as a **string**. If JSON, this should be a stringified JSON.
body.title: Body

expected_status.description: The `expected_status` field is used to make sure the validation was successful. It is an integer that should match the status code of the validate request when it is successful.
expected_status.title: Expected Status

headers.description:
Headers can be essential to alter the response received from hitting a particular URL. Headers can be passed during validating by using the `headers` field.

For eg, a `Content-Type` header can be passed in the following way:

```yml
global_envs:
  - label: ES URL
    key: ES_URL
    value: http://localhost:9200
    validate:
      headers:
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
```
headers.title: Headers

method.description:
It might be important to specify the method field in order to get the `expected_status`. This can be done by passing the method as a string. By default the value is set to `GET`.

Some of the other valid options are:

- `POST`
- `PUT`
- `PATCH`
method.title: Method

url.description: The `url` field is used to specify the URL that is supposed to be hit during validating the global environment before adding it.
url.title: URL

validate.title: Validate

value.description: Value of the global variable. This can be considered the most important field of the global variable since this will contain the value of the global variable.
value.title: Value

global_envs.title: Global Envs

priority.description:
In case of a conflict in pipeline routes, the pipeline with highest priority would get invoked.

Priority is an important and useful field. This can be used to set the order in which pipelines with same route can be executed when a request comes.
priority.title: Priority

routes.description:
**This is a required field**

Pipeline routes.

Routes is an array of route which essentially indicates which routes the pipeline will be listening to. In other words, which routes will trigger the pipeline can be defined using this field.

Following is an example of routes:

```yml
routes:
  - path: good-books-ds-pipeline/_reactivesearch
    method: POST
    classify:
      category: reactivesearch
```

Above code indicates that the pipeline will be triggered if the route is `good-books-ds-pipeline/_reactivesearch` and the method is `POST`.

classify.description: Useful to categorize the route. This is extremely useful to understand what kind of request is being sent through the route is suggested to be used in all pipeline definitions as ReactiveSearch way better when this is defined properly.

acl.description:
It a sub-category of category.

This can be thought of as narrowing down the type of route. For eg, if category is the type of fruits, sub category can be type of a particular fruit. So Apple can be considered a category and Red or Green apples can be considered ACL's of Apple.
acl.title: ACL

category.description:
Route category.

This indicates the category of the route. This is useful for the internal functioning of the pipeline.
category.title: Category

classify.title: Classify Route

method.description:
HTTP method for route.

This indicates the method which if it hits the route then the pipeline will be triggered.
method.title: Method

path.description:
Route path. For example, '/books-search'.

[More can be read about the route matching process here](/docs/pipelines/concepts/execution-process).
path.title: Path

recordLogs.description: If set to 'true', then Appbase would record logs for the pipeline route. Defaults to 'false'.
recordLogs.title: Record Logs

routes.title: Routes

stages.description:
**This is a required field**

Pipeline stages.

Stages can be thought of as steps of the pipeline that are executed (not always in the order of specification).

Following is an example of pipeline stages:

```yml

stages:
  - use: authorization
  - use: useCache
  - id: echo something
    script: "console.log(\'Echoing something from a JS script instead of shell!\');"
  - use: reactivesearchQuery
    continueOnError: false
  - use: elasticsearchQuery
    continueOnError: false
  - use: recordAnalytics
```

Above uses some pre-built stages as well as a stage where the `script` field is used to just run some custom JavaScript. More can be read about the pre-built stages in the following section.

async.description: If set to 'true', then stage would get executed in parallel to other stages. Async stages can not modify the global 'request' and 'response' properties. Although, you can define a synchronous stage to consume the data of async stage (would be present in global context with stage id) to modify the global request/response.
async.title: Execute Asynchronously

continueOnError.description: If set to 'false' and an error occurs in stage execution, then Pipeline execution would stop immediately with an error.
continueOnError.title: Continue on Error

enabled.description: Set to 'false' to disable a stage. Defaults to 'true'.
enabled.title: Enabled

id.description: User-defined unique identifier for stages. It is useful to define stage dependencies using 'needs' property.
id.title: Stage Id

inputs.description: Inputs required for a pre-built stage execution. The inputs structure may vary for each stage.
inputs.title: Stage Inputs

needs.description: Useful to define the dependencies among stages. For example, if stage 'A' depends on stages 'B' and 'C' then stage 'A' would define 'needs' property as ['B', 'C']. Stage 'A' would only get executed once the stages 'B' and 'C' are completed.
needs.title: Needs

script.description: Custom script to modify the request/response. You can also write custom variables to global context which can be consumed by other stages.
script.title: Script

scriptRef.description:
Path to script file.

This is similar to _script_, except that it accepts a path to a file instead of an inline string. This is useful for cases where there is a very large JS script that needs to be used in one or more stages of a pipeline.
scriptRef.title: Script Reference

trigger.description: Trigger will indicate whether or not to trigger the stage.

expression.description: Custom trigger expression. You can read more at [here](https://docs.appbase.io/docs/search/rules/#advanced-editor).
expression.title: Trigger Expression

trigger.title: Trigger

use.description: Use a pre-built stage from Appbase.

AIAnswer.description: This stage will generate answers based on the top results from the request query and return them

apiKey.description: (mandatory) OpenAI API key to access the API
apiKey.title: API Key

docTemplate.description: (optional) Template for building the context message for each hit. Supports special character 'source' that refers to the document '_source' field. Eg: '${source.text} is ${source.summary} with url as ${source.url}'
docTemplate.title: Doc Template

maxTokens.description: (optional) Maximum number of tokens to pass to ChatGPT. Read more about it here: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat/create-max_tokens
maxTokens.title: Maximum Tokens

model.description: Model to use for getting the vector embeddings. Options can be found at https://platform.openai.com/docs/models. Defaults to 'gpt-3.5-turbo'
model.title: Model

queryId.description: (optional) ID of the query where hits are going to be extracted from. This should be rarely needed, as it is picked from the ReactiveSearch query body to a 'search' type of query, with a fallback to a 'suggestion' type of query.
queryId.title: Query ID

queryTemplate.description: (optional) Template for the query that is passed to ChatGPT as the question. Supports special character 'value' that refers to the 'value' field passed in the query object, e.g. Answer the query: '${value}'. Think step-by-step, cite the source after the answer and ensure the source is from the provided context.
queryTemplate.title: Query Template

systemPrompt.description: (optional) First message that will be sent to ChatGPT from the system. Defaults to: You are a helpful assistant
systemPrompt.title: System Prompt

temperature.description: (optional) Temperature to pass to ChatGPT. Defaults to 1. Read more about it here: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat/create-temperature
temperature.title: Temperature

topDocsForContext.description: Number of documents from the top hits to pass to ChatGPT as context for the query. This value is capped to the minimum value of size (hits fetched in a request) and 100. Defaults to 3
topDocsForContext.title: Top Docs For Context

AIAnswer.title: Answer AI

addFilter.description: Add Filter action allows you to define the term filters that will get applied on the search type of queries. For example, if somebody searches for iphone then you may want to apply a brand filter with value as apple.

data.description: To add a custom filter to the query, for e.g, '{ 'authors.keyword': 'Simone Elkeles' }' would filters books by author.
data.title: Data

addFilter.title: Add Filter

boost.description: Boost stage is useful to boost search results by a specific fieldâ€™s value, for example, show items with 'holiday-sale' and 'premium' values for 'tag' field above other items.

boostFactor.description: Boost factor to be used by boost operation, for e.g, boost_factor as 2 & boostType as 'multiply' would multiply the score by 2 and re-ranks the results.
boostFactor.title: Boost Factor

boostMaxDocs.description: Maximum number of documents to boost.
boostMaxDocs.title: Boost Max Docs

boostSizeThreshold.description: Maximum 'from' + 'size' value till the boost stage will get applied
boostSizeThreshold.title: Boost Size Threshold

boostType.description: To define the type of boost stage. Defaults to 'score'.
boostType.title: Boost Type

dataField.description: Field name to match value to find documents to rank.
dataField.title: Data Field

queryFormat.description: Query operator for boost query, can have values as 'or' and 'and'. Defaults to 'or'.
queryFormat.title: Query Format

value.description: To define the matching values to boost results, for e.g show items with '['holiday-sale', 'premium values']' for 'tag' data field above other items.
value.title: Value

boost.title: Boost

customData.description: Helps in sending the custom JSON data in the search response. This will be helpful when you want to send some extra information to the frontend, which can help in rendering more specific information.

data.description: Custom data to be returned in response, for e.g, { facets: { color: 'red', brand: 'Apple' }}.
data.title: Data

customData.title: Apply Custom Data

elasticsearchQuery.description:
To perform a request to Elasticsearch Backend.

Elasticsearch stage supports async execution. In case of asynchronous execution, you're expected to write a merge script to consume the response from elasticsearch.
The elasticsearch response would be present in global script context with stage Id (defaults to elasticsearchQuery) as key.

body.description: Request body in string format, e.g, {"query":{"match_all":{}}}.
body.title: Body

independentBody.description: Array of independent requests, i:e ones that contain the endpoint in the query.
independentBody.title: Independent Body

method.description: Http request method, for e.g, 'POST'. The default value is the pipeline request method.
method.title: Request Method

params.description: Request query params, for e.g, '{ format: 'JSON' }'
params.title: Query params

parseResponseToReactivesearch.description: If set to 'true', then it would transform the Elasticsearch response to RS API response. Defaults to 'true', if route category is 'reactivesearch'.
parseResponseToReactivesearch.title: Parse Response to ReactiveSearch API

url.description: Elasticsearch URL, for e.g, 'https://@appbase-demo-ansible-abxiydt-arc.searchbase.io'. The URL can have path and query params too, for instance, 'https://appbase-demo-ansible-abxiydt-arc.searchbase.io/_cat/indices?format=JSON'.
url.title: Request URL

elasticsearchQuery.title: Elasticsearch

hideResults.description: It helps in hiding certain results from getting included in the actual search results. For example, you want to hide products that not available in the store, or you want to hide results that contain irrelevant data.

data.description: An array of document ids to hide from results. For e.g, '['id_1', 'id_2']'
data.title: Data

hideResults.title: Hide Results

httpRequest.description: This stage is useful to perform HTTP requests.

body.description: Request body in string format, e.g, {"query":{"match_all":{}}}.
body.title: Body

method.description: Http request method, for e.g, 'POST'. The default value is the pipeline request method.
method.title: Request Method

params.description: Request query params, for e.g, '{ format: 'JSON' }'
params.title: Query params

httpRequest.title: HTTP Request

kNN.description: k Nearest Neighbor (kNN) modifies the ElasticSearch Query with a script_score condition to re-rank the top n results.

AIConfig.description: Configuration for the AnswerAI part of the query. This will only be considered if 'enableAI' is set to 'true'
AIConfig.title: AI Config

FAQSuggestionsConfig.description: additional options for getting FAQ suggestions
FAQSuggestionsConfig.title: FAQSuggestionsConfig

aggregationField.description: field for doing the aggregation on

aggregations.description: utilize the built-in aggregations for range type of queries
aggregations.title: aggregations

applyStopwords.description: whether or not predict a suggestion which starts or ends with a stopword
applyStopwords.title: applyStopwords

calendarinterval.description: set the histogram bar interval when range value is of type date
calendarinterval.title: calendarInterval

candidates.description: indicates the number of candidates to consider while using the script_score functionality to reorder the results using kNN
candidates.title: candidates

customQuery.description: query to be used by dependent queries specified using the react property
customQuery.title: customQuery

dataField.description: fields to run the query term on
dataField.title: dataField

deepPagination.description: whether or not the enable deep pagination of results
deepPagination.title: deepPagination

deepPaginationConfig.description: additional options for deepPagination for it to work properly
deepPaginationConfig.title: deepPaginationConfig

defaultQuery.description: customize the source query. This doesn't get leaked to other queries unlike customQuery
defaultQuery.title: defaultQuery

distinctField.description: returns only distinct value documents for the specified field
distinctField.title: distinctField

distinctFieldConfig.description: additional options to the distinctField property
distinctFieldConfig.title: distinctFieldConfig

enableAI.description: Whether or not to enable Answer AI to inject AI based answer in the response
enableAI.title: enableAI

enableEndpointSuggestions.description: whether or not to enable endpoint suggestions
enableEndpointSuggestions.title: enableEndpointSuggestions

enableFAQSuggestions.description: whether or not to enable FAQ suggestions
enableFAQSuggestions.title: enableFAQSuggestions

enableFeaturedSuggestions.description: whether or not to enable featured suggestions
enableFeaturedSuggestions.title: enableFeaturedSuggestions

enableIndexSuggestions.description: whether or not to enable index suggestions
enableIndexSuggestions.title: enableIndexSuggestions

enablePopularSuggestions.description: whether or not to enable popular suggestions
enablePopularSuggestions.title: enablePopularSuggestions

enablePredictiveSuggestions.description: predicts the next relevant words from the value of a field based on the search query typed by the user
enablePredictiveSuggestions.title: enablePredictiveSuggestions

enableRecentSuggestions.description: whether or not to enable recent suggestions
enableRecentSuggestions.title: enableRecentSuggestions

enableSynonyms.description: control the synonyms behavior for a particular query
enableSynonyms.title: enableSynonyms

endpoint.description: endpoint and other details where the query should be hit
endpoint.title: endpoint

excludeFields.description: indicates which dataFields to exclude in search results
excludeFields.title: excludeFields

excludeValues.description: values to exclude in term queries
excludeValues.title: excludeValues

execute.description: whether or not to execute the query
execute.title: execute

featuredSuggestionsConfig.description: additional options to specify for featured suggestions
featuredSuggestionsConfig.title: featuredSuggestionsConfig

from.description: index from which the results should start from
from.title: from

fuzziness.description: indicates the fuzziness of the query
fuzziness.title: fuzziness

highlight.description: whether or not to enable highlighting of results
highlight.title: highlight

highlightField.description: fields to highlight in the results
highlightField.title: highlightField

includeFields.description: indicates which dataFields to include in search results
includeFields.title: includeFields

includeNullValues.description: whether or not to include null values
includeNullValues.title: includeNullValues

includeValues.description: values to include in term queries
includeValues.title: includeValues

index.description: explicitly specify an index to run the query on
index.title: index

indexSuggestionsConfig.description: additional options to specify for index suggestions
indexSuggestionsConfig.title: indexSuggestionsConfig

maxPredictedWords.description: specify the the maximum number of relevant words that are predicted
maxPredictedWords.title: maxPredictedWords

missingLabel.description: custom label to show when showMissing is set to true
missingLabel.title: missingLabel

pagination.description: enable pagination for term type of queries
pagination.title: pagination

popularSuggestionsConfig.description: additional options for getting popular suggestions
popularSuggestionsConfig.title: popularSuggestionsConfig

queryFormat.description: the operator to join multiple values in the query.value field
queryFormat.title: queryFormat

queryString.description: whether or not to allow creating a complex search that includes wildcard characters
queryString.title: queryString

queryVector.description: specify a vector to match for the reordering the results using kNN
queryVector.title: queryVector

range.description: range value to filter the histogram aggregations
range.title: range

rankFeature.description: boost relevant score of documents based on rank_feature fields
rankFeature.title: rankFeature

react.description: which queries to react the current query with
react.title: react

recentSuggestionsConfig.description: additional options for getting recent suggestions
recentSuggestionsConfig.title: recentSuggestionsConfig

script.description: indicates the script to run while reordering the results
script.title: script

searchLanguage.description: used to apply language specific stopwords for predictive suggestions
searchLanguage.title: searchLanguage

searchOperators.description: use special characters in the search query to enable advanced search behavior
searchOperators.title: searchOperators

searchboxId.description: searchbox id for a suggestion query
searchboxId.title: searchboxId

selectAllLabel.description: allows adding a new property in the list with a particular value such that when selected
selectAllLabel.title: selectAllLabel

showDistinctSuggestions.description: whether or not to show distinct suggestions
showDistinctSuggestions.title: showDistinctSuggestions

showMissing.description: whether or not to show missing results
showMissing.title: showMissing

sortField.description: field(s) to run the sorting on
sortField.title: sortField

urlField.description: convenience prop that allows returning the URL value in the suggestion's response
urlField.title: urlField

value.description: value for the query. Can be string or array of strings
value.title: value

vectorDataField.description: field in the index to be used to reorder the results using kNN
vectorDataField.title: vectorDataField

kNN.title: kNN Response

mongoDBQuery.description:
To perform a request to MongoDB.

MongoDB stage supports async execution. In case of asynchronous execution, you're expected to write a merge script to consume the response from mongoDB.
The mongoDB response would be present in global script context with stage Id (defaults to mongoDBQuery) as key.

body.description: MongoDB custom aggregations query, for e.g, [ { '$facet': { 'hits': [ { '$limit': 10 } ], 'total': [ { '$count': 'count' } ] } } ]
body.title: Request Body

host.description: Host name and port of instance(s). For example, 'sample.host:27017'.
host.title: Host

mongoDBQuery.title: MongoDB

openAIEmbeddings.description: Get vector embeddings from OpenAI based on the passed text value

apiKey.description: OpenAI API key to be able to access the API
apiKey.title: API Key

model.description: Model to use for getting the vector embeddings. Options can be found at https://platform.openai.com/docs/models. Defaults to 'text-embedding-ada-002'
model.title: Model

text.description: Text to get the vector for. Eg: 'test string'
text.title: Text

useWithReactiveSearchQuery.description: When set as true, the output vector will be populated into the ReactiveSearch query where vectorDataField key is present. Defaults to 'false'
useWithReactiveSearchQuery.title: Use With ReactiveSearch Query

openAIEmbeddings.title: Open AI Embeddings

openAIEmbeddingsIndex.description: This stage will generate the vector embedding of the inputKeys passed and inject the output to the request body

apiKey.description: OpenAI API key to be able to access the API
apiKey.title: API Key

inputKeys.description: Keys from the request body that should be used for getting the embedding.
inputKeys.title: Input Keys

model.description: Model to use for getting the vector embeddings. Options can be found at https://platform.openai.com/docs/models. Defaults to 'text-embedding-ada-002'
model.title: Model

outputKey.description: Key to write the vector data to in the request body
outputKey.title: Output Key

openAIEmbeddingsIndex.title: Open AI Embeddings Index

promoteResults.description: Helps in promoting results at a certain position in your result set. For example, when a user searches for iphone you want to promote air pods.

data.description: An array of objects to promote, for e.g, '[{ 'doc': { '_id': 'id_1', '_source': { 'title': 'id_1' } }, 'position': 10 }]'.
data.title: Data

promoteResults.title: Promote Results

reactivesearchQuery.description: Reactivesearch stage translates the reactivesearch query to equivalent query of search backend.
reactivesearchQuery.title: Reactivesearch

recordAnalytics.description: To record Appbase search analytics. Record Analytics stage is only applicable for reactivesearch requests.
recordAnalytics.title: Record Analytics

recordClick.description: Record click event for a search query term or a previously searched query (represented by a X-Search-Id)
recordClick.title: Record Click

recordConversion.description: Record conversion event for a previously searched query (represented by a X-Search-Id)
recordConversion.title: Record Conversion

recordFavorite.description: Record a favorite (aka like) user action for a search result document (aka hit)
recordFavorite.title: Record Favorite

recordSaveSearch.description: Record the search state of a ReactiveSearch query, useful for replaying a query at a later time
recordSaveSearch.title: Record Saved Search

removeWords.description:
Removing words is the progressive loosening of query constraints to include more results when none are initially found.

For example, imagine an online smartphone shop that sold a limited inventory of iPhones in only 16GB and 32GB varieties. Users searching for â€œiphone 5 64gbâ€ would see no results. This is not ideal behavior - it would be far better to show users some iPhone 5 results instead of a blank page.

data.description: To remove a list of words from the search query, for e.g, ['iphone'].
data.title: Data

removeWords.title: Remove Words

replaceSearchTerm.description: It helps in replacing the user's entire search query with another query. Helps in showing relevant results to users, especially when you are aware of the analytics that certain search term is returning no results.

data.description: Search query to replace the request's query, for e.g, 'iphoneX'.
data.title: Data

replaceSearchTerm.title: Replace Search Term

replaceWords.description: It allows you to replace words in search query. For example, if you make tv a synonym for television, the stage can replace tv with television so that only television is used to search.

data.description: To replace words from search query, for e.g, { 'iphone': 'iphoneX' }.
data.title: Data

replaceWords.title: Replace Words

searchRelevancy.description: Search Relevancy stage is useful to define the default settings for search queries. For example, to set the default size as 10 for search queries.

geo.description: Default query settings applicable to 'geo' type of queries. You can find all the properties at [here](https://docs.appbase.io/docs/search/reactivesearch-api/reference).

AIConfig.title: AI Config

term.title: Search Query Settings

searchRelevancy.title: Search Relevancy

searchboxPreferences.description: Searchbox Preferences stage is useful to specify the searchbox preference id for making suggestion queries. A searchbox id represents the design + layout, popular, recent, and endpoint settings for a suggestions experience, configurable from the ReactiveSearch dashboard

id.description: Searchbox Id to apply the searchbox preferences for suggestion type of requests.
id.title: SearchBox Id

searchboxPreferences.title: Searchbox Preferences

solrQuery.description: To perform a request to a Solr search engine

app.description: App to search the query in. Example: 'appbase'
app.title: App

collection.description: Collection in Solr to run the query against. Example: 'appbase'
collection.title: Collection

credentials.description: Credentials to access the fusion host. Example: 'username:password'
credentials.title: Credentials

headers.description: Headers to be passed in the Solr query request.
headers.title: Headers

host.description: Host name and port for Fusion. For example: 'localhost:6764'
host.title: Host

profile.description: Profile in Fusion to search the query in. Example: 'appbase'
profile.title: Profile

protocol.description: Protocol to use for connecting. Defaults to 'http'.
protocol.title: Protocol

query.description: Query to run on Solr. If passed, this query will be prioritized over the query built from ReactiveSearch stage. Example: 'q=*:*&qf=some_field'
query.title: Query

queryString.description: Query string to pass in the final query along with the built query. Should be an object with key value pairs. Example: 'extraParams=debug'
queryString.title: Query String

suggestionProfile.description: Profile in Fusion to send the request to for suggestion type of query. Example: 'popular-searches'
suggestionProfile.title: Suggestion Profile

uri.description: URI to connect to the fusion instance. If passed, host, app, profile and credentials will be ignored and not required. Example: 'http://username:password@localhost:6764/api/apps/appbase/query/appbase'
uri.title: URI

solrQuery.title: Solr

useCache.description: To apply the cached response. It is recommended to apply cached response after authentication.
useCache.title: Apply Cached Response

zincQuery.description: To perform a request to Zinc

credentials.description: Credentials to access the Zinc host. Example: 'username:password'
credentials.title: Credentials

headers.description: Headers to be passed in the Zinc request.
headers.title: Headers

host.description: Host name and port for Zinc. For example: 'localhost:4080'
host.title: Host

independentBody.description: Array of independent requests, i:e ones that contain the endpoint in the query.
independentBody.title: Independent Body

protocol.description: Protocol to use for connecting. Defaults to 'http'.
protocol.title: Protocol

url.description: Zinc URL, for e.g: 'https://admin:Complexpass#123@zinc-url.com'. The URL can have path and query params too, for instance, 'https://zinc-url.com/_cat/indices?format=JSON'.
url.title: Request URL

zincQuery.title: Zinc

use.title: Pre-built Stage

stages.title: Stages

trigger.description:
Trigger expression is to define the condition of Pipeline invocation. For example, only execute pipeline if query is \'mobile phone\'. Check the documentation at [here](https://docs.appbase.io/docs/search/rules/#configure-if-condition).

Following is an example trigger for a pipeline that searches for mobile phones:

```yml
trigger:
  type: always
  expression: $query exactlyMatches "iphone x"
```

Above trigger will **always** run and execute the expression provided to it.

expression.description: Custom trigger expression. You can read more at [here](https://docs.appbase.io/docs/search/rules/#advanced-editor).
expression.title: Trigger Expression
